characters.name: Jermaine Jangle
characters.bio: A top tier jangler who knows naught but the art of bonk

characters.name: Jimmy Biscuits
characters.bio: Sweet and covered n honey baybeeee

characters.name: Undyr
characters.bio: Have you heard of the good book?

characters.name: Hungle Tonnomore
characters.bio: The guy likes bread. Ok? That's it. Bread and power. Ok... that's it.

characters.name: Donna Trenchcoat
characters.bio: Yes I'd like to open an adults saving account

characters.name: Sir Tubb
characters.bio: Another round on me! Yes, tubbs all around!!

characters.name: Lorretaaaa
characters.bio: Uh oh, she's coming for ya

species.name: Arenite
species.description: An old and proud race of wanderers, originating from the dry, grassy island of Arkose

species.name: Goge
species.description: Good and big, the Goge are a hardy people who have made their home in Goge's Staircase

species.name: El Dun
species.description: What they don't have in size, El-Dun make up for in brain power. Need something fixed? Find an El-Dun

species.name: Vir
species.description: Instantly recognizable with grey ashen skin and snow white hair, the Vir are an ancient race dedicated to fervent worship of the Circle

species.name: Haima
species.description: Short... pasty... portly... the life of the party? No one makes a better entertainer (or businessman) than a Haima

backgrounds.name: Nomad
backgrounds.description: Arenite nomads are usually born in Arkose as a member of a family clan. They are shepherds and hunters who band together and roam the grasslands of Arkoseâ€™s interior. Nomads as adventurers are hardy and tough, capable of weathering intense conditions.

backgrounds.name: Mercenary
backgrounds.description: Arenite mercenaries are usually born in Arkose as a member of a family clan. These are the nomads who for some reason or another chose to leave their homeland to become a wandering adventurer. Mercenaries as adventurers are masters of combat.

backgrounds.name: Immigrant
backgrounds.description: Arenite immigrants are born either to immigrant parents or in Arkose as a member of a family clan early in life. These members of a modern mass migration are most often found in Severra, Minora, or on the Fire Islands. Immigrants as adventurers are attuned to themselves and their surroundings, and their experience with language learning makes them skilled diplomats.

backgrounds.name: Rancher
backgrounds.description: Arenite ranchers are born either to immigrant parents or in Arkose as a member of a family clan early in life. These early members of a modern mass migration are most often found in the Wastes, Steya Darcca, and especially in the city of Granitoge, where they work alongside Humans and Jelids as settlers. Ranchers as adventurers are confident in outdoor situations and are quite skilled at working with animals.

backgrounds.name: Islander
backgrounds.description: Arenite islanders are born on the Fire Islands. Islanders are often the children of Arcanists, and as such are predisposed to its use. Islanders as adventurers are skilled with arcana on or off the high seas.

backgrounds.name: Citizen
backgrounds.description: Jelid citizens usually hail from the Masked Lands, particularly from Severra. Many Jelid citizens aspire to be adventurers. Citizens as adventurers are sharp and quick on their feet.

backgrounds.name: Wanderer
backgrounds.description: Jelid wanderers can come from any number of places, and have been to them all anyways. Due to their natural wanderlust, many Jelids roam from place to place. As adventurers, wanderers are skilled guides and travelers.

backgrounds.name: Tribal
backgrounds.description: Tribal Jelids come from the jungle islands in the Golden Sea, northern Oeleza, the Fire Islands, or Northern Severra. They shirk structured society in favor of the wild life of their ancestors. As adventurers, tribal adventurers are masters of ranged combat.

backgrounds.name: Storyteller
backgrounds.description: Jelid storytellers are often born in the Masked Lands. These wandering bards follow in the footsteps of the countless great storytellers in Jelid history like the famed Enzian Maas, author of the Tale of Rahul. As adventurers, storytellers are charming and adept in social situations.

backgrounds.name: Islander
backgrounds.description: Jelid islanders are born on the Fire Islands. Islanders are often the children of Arcanists, and as such are predisposed to its use. Islanders as adventurers are skilled with arcana on or off the high seas.

backgrounds.name: Veteran
backgrounds.description: A Gogic veteran was most likely born in Goger, Minora, Granitoge, or in Leona. A Goge with military background most likely did his duty serving in the imperial military as a drafted soldier during one of the many wars in the Viran States between the years 30 and 45, or the veteran served in the domestic military and peacekeeping force of Goger or Minora.

backgrounds.name: Citizen
backgrounds.description: Gogic citizens were often born in Goger, Minora, Granitoge, or Leona, but may have traveled far from their homeland. Here they act as natural leaders, frequently found in positions such as mayor of a small town, or in high-ranking government positions. Gogic citizens as adventurers make decisive leaders and charming facemen.

backgrounds.name: Thug
backgrounds.description: Gogic thugs often call home one of the many large northern cities of Aldmerra, such as Minora, Goger, or Fiora. A thirst for profit, a desire to get back at the man, or even just plain necessity can cause a Goge to go down the lawless path. As adventurers, Gogic thugs make for imposing figures on or off the battlefield.

backgrounds.name: Craftsman
backgrounds.description: Gogic Craftsmen can be found in almost any major city of Aldmerra, but many have spent some time at the Lumus Academy mastering their trade. These master artificiers and smiths create technological wonders, sturdy metalworks, and even alchemical concoctions. As adventurers, Gogic craftsmen always have a trick up their sleeve.

backgrounds.name: Islander
backgrounds.description: Gogic islanders are born on the Fire Islands. Islanders are often the children of Arcanists, and as such are predisposed to its use. Islanders as adventurers are skilled with arcana on or off the high seas.

backgrounds.name: Academic
backgrounds.description: El-Dun academics are usually born on Elandun and spent the majority of their youth there studying in the Lumus Academy. Now graduated, or perhaps on a research assignment, the academic travels abroad. As adventurers, academics are fonts of helpful knowledge and make skilled tinkers or channelers.

backgrounds.name: Sailor
backgrounds.description: El-Dun sailors are usually from one of the many port cities of Aldmerra. As the sailor grew up, they became more and more experienced with maritime affairs, and have had experience at sea. El-Dun sailors as adventurers are clear-headed and tough.

backgrounds.name: Criminal
backgrounds.description: El-Dun criminals are usually born in the Free City of Goger, Minora, or any other major city of Aldmerra as a minority. A thirst for profit, a desire to get back at the man, or even just plain necessity can cause a El-Dun to go down the lawless path. As adventurers, criminals are handy at doing any wet work that adventuring sometimes calls for.

backgrounds.name: Citizen
backgrounds.description: El-Dun citizens are usually born either on Elandun or in the Free City of Goger, Minora, or as a minority in any of the major cities of Aldmerra. Many El-Dun citizens aspire to become adventurers. As adventures, El-Dun citizens are both street smart and book smart.

backgrounds.name: Islander
backgrounds.description: El-Dun islanders are born on the Fire Islands. Islanders are often the children of Arcanists, and as such are predisposed to its use. Islanders as adventurers are skilled with arcana on or off the high seas.

backgrounds.name: Citizen
backgrounds.description: Vir citizens are usually born in the Viran States or in Minora. Many Viran citizens aspire to become channelers. As adventures, Viran citizens are clever and knowledgeable about a range of topics.

backgrounds.name: Evangelist
backgrounds.description: Vir evangelists are usually born in the Viran States or Minora, or was the child of refugees. Devotion to a god has led this Vir to preach and attempt to encourage others to become similarly devoted to that god. As adventurers, Evangelists are natural channelers.

backgrounds.name: Refugee
backgrounds.description: Vir refugees were displaced at some point in their life by the wars throughout the Viran States, or they are descended from the refugees of the Severran-Imperial War during the Dusk of the Fourth Age. These Vir are often minorities in their communities, and they are in the habit of working hard to blend in. Vir refugees as adventurers are masters of going unnoticed.

backgrounds.name: Criminal
backgrounds.description: Vir criminals are born in the Viran States, in Minora, or as a child of refugees. A thirst for profit, a desire to get back at the man, or even just plain necessity can cause a Vir to go down the lawless path. As adventurers, criminals are handy at doing any wet work that adventuring sometimes calls for.

backgrounds.name: Islander
backgrounds.description: Vir islanders are born on the Fire Islands. Islanders are often the children of Arcanists, and as such are predisposed to its use. Islanders as adventurers are skilled with arcana on or off the high seas.

backgrounds.name: Merchant
backgrounds.description: Haima merchants are most often born in a port city of Leona or in Minora. However, in life, merchants often take to the high seas in trading vessels. Merchants as adventurers are quick-witted and discerning individuals.

backgrounds.name: Refugee
backgrounds.description: Haima refugees were displaced at some point in their life by the wars in southern Leona, or they are descended from the refugees of the Severran-Imperial War during the Dusk of the Fourth Age. These Haima are often minorities in their communities, and they are in the habit of working hard to blend in. Haima refugees as adventurers are always finding ways to wriggle their way out of trouble.

backgrounds.name: Veteran
backgrounds.description: Haima veterans served in the Imperial military, most likely doing a campaign in the Viran States in one of the many wars fought between year 30 and 45. As adventurers, these portly powerhouses make for burly fighters and are natural leaders.

backgrounds.name: Spy
backgrounds.description: Haima spies are usually born in Leona or Minora. Using his charm, this mound of subterfuge infiltrated targets and gathered information, often for some sort of criminal organization. As adventurers, Haima Spies are masters of disguise.

backgrounds.name: Islander
backgrounds.description: Haima islanders are born on the Fire Islands. Islanders are often the children of Arcanists, and as such are predisposed to its use. Islanders as adventurers are skilled with arcana on or off the high seas.

classes.name: Outlaw
classes.description: A quick, patient, and deadly marksman with a mean-streak and a temper to match.

classes.name: Arcanist
classes.description: A deadly fighter whose strength is sourced from their burning blood

classes.name: Tinker
classes.description: A craftsman whose artificed wonders and miraculous alchemical compounds are a wonder to behold.

classes.name: Channeler
classes.description: A vessel of the Gods. Channel the power of the Circle through your fingertips.

classes.name: Singer
classes.description: A charming rogue with a knack for performance and subterfuge.

subclasses.name: Paladin
subclasses.description: Supplement your muscle with some magic

subclasses.name: Outlaw
subclasses.description: Hawk eyes and a trigger finger. This town ain't big enough etc...

subclasses.name: Hunter
subclasses.description: A hunter must hunt. Get up close to satiate that peculiar bloodlust.

subclasses.name: Ranger
subclasses.description: An outlaw with a pious side. Shoots lead and spells.

subclasses.name: Arcanist
subclasses.description: Use that Good Blood for good. Or evil. Whatever, really.

subclasses.name: Wolf Knight
subclasses.description: Arcanists specialized in combat as well as arcana.

subclasses.name: Magi
subclasses.description: Arcanists specialized in channeling a god.

subclasses.name: Tinker
subclasses.description: Gunk guns, buzz bots, ichors, gee-whiz!

subclasses.name: Mechanist
subclasses.description: Nerd with a knack for riflery.

subclasses.name: Channeler
subclasses.description: Who needs push-ups when you have prayer?

subclasses.name: Monk
subclasses.description: A Channeler who doesn't mind getting their fists bloody.

subclasses.name: Singer
subclasses.description: I had no choice... I was born with the gift of a golden voice.

subclasses.name: Skald
subclasses.description: Channel the gods with your instrument. The devil went down to Arkose...?

gods.name: Sunface
gods.description: Matron deity of the Arenite people. She represents the heat and light of each dawn, the flourishing of life, and the beginning of a new day. Her devotees channel her to create flames from nothingness and manipulate the heat of the world around them.

gods.name: Moonface
gods.description: Patron deity of the El-Dun people. He represents the darkness of night, the glow of the unknown, and the end of each known day. His devotees channel him to create powerful beams of cosmic energy and bring about the black of the beyond to swallow their foes.

gods.name: Escritorio
gods.description: Patron deity of the Jelid people and the twin brother of Goge. He determines the cycle of life, the never-ending change of the seasons, the currents, the weather, and the revolution of the new over the old. His Devotees channel him to twist the elements of life and to alter their own form.

gods.name: Goge, the Architect
gods.description: Patron deity of the Goge people and the twin brother of Escritorio. He represents the unchanging mountain cliff, the strength of unity and constancy, and the slow, undaunted churning of the earth. His devotees channel him to shape the stones and to bring tectonic destruction from beneath the feet of their foes.

gods.name: Faelina of Light
gods.description: One of the two ascended Human deities. She represents the light of knowledge, kindness to a stranger, and the power of goodness to overcome cruelty. Her devotees channel her to cast powerful healing magics and to devastate their foes with her scintillating light.

gods.name: Garthank, the Trickster
gods.description: One of the two ascended Human deities. He represents the vicissitudes of fate, the whims of chance, and a short but pleasurable life. His devotees channel him to load the dice in their favor and to play tricks on their friends and foes alike.

spells.name: Blessing of Dawn
spells.shortDescription: Feel the warmth of Sunface shine upon you, revitalizing you in your moment of greatest darkness.
spells.fullDescription: Make a Religion vs. 15 (-Devotion level) check. On success, recover 2d6(+Att) Life or Stamina. You give off 30ft of daylight for the next hour. You gain one point of devotion.

spells.name: Pyromancy
spells.shortDescription: Create flame at will and control its movements.
spells.fullDescription: Cause flames within 15ft to dim, brighten, change color, move up to 5ft in directions you choose, and form shapes of your choice. You can strike combatants within range with these flames. Make an attunement Spell Attack vs Dex. On hit, the target takes 1d6(+Att) Fire damage.

spells.name: Thermomancy
spells.shortDescription: Control the heat of an object you can touch, up to waters boiling temperature or down to its freezing point.
spells.fullDescription: As an action, you can heat up or cool off an object you are touching up to 100 degrees Celsius, or down to 0 degrees Celsius. If used on a unit, they make a Constitution vs Attunement saving throw or take 1d6(+Att) Fire/Frost damage. If Fire damage, the target takes an additional 1d6 Fire damage. If Frost damage, the target is slowed for a turn.

spells.name: Firebolt
spells.shortDescription: Fire a bolt of flame at a single foe.
spells.fullDescription: Target takes 1d12(+Att) Fire Damage and takes ongoing 1d6 fire damage.

spells.name: Personal Sun
spells.shortDescription: Summon a small orb of light that hovers above your head.
spells.fullDescription: A floating ball of light appears above your head, giving off 60ft of daylight. It can follow you around, or you can place it at the location you are standing as a bonus action. While out of combat, you and any allies within 10ft of the orb recover 1d6(+Con) Life and Stamina every 20 minutes.

spells.name: Photosynthesis
spells.shortDescription: While in direct sunlight, you slowly recover your life essence.
spells.fullDescription: After 20 mins spent in direct sunlight, you recover up to half of your maximum life. While in combat, at the beginning of a turn spent in direct sunlight, recover 1(+Con) life.

spells.name: Flame Whirl
spells.shortDescription: Launch a whirling string of flame at a group of foes.
spells.fullDescription: Targets takes 2d6(+Att) Fire Damage and takes ongoing 1d6 fire damage.

spells.name: Blessing of the Lake
spells.shortDescription: The soft sinking of the Moon Lake calms the mind and girds against mental intrusion.
spells.fullDescription: Make a Religion check vs. 15(-DevotionLevel). On success, recover 2d6(+Att) Will. You are advantaged on saves against mental effects for the next hour (frenzy, fear, charm, etc.). You gain one point of devotion.

spells.name: Phase Shift
spells.shortDescription: Step through a slip between the weave of reality and reappear instantly in a nearby location.
spells.fullDescription: Teleport 5ft in any direction instantaneously. Can only be used once per turn (once every 10 seconds outside of combat). You must be able to perceive your destination with three or more senses in order to Phase Shift into it. Senses include sight, sound, taste, touch, scent, dreamsense, etc. This shift is considered a true teleport, and so is unaffected by movement/speed restrictions.

spells.name: Telekinesis
spells.shortDescription: Move a distant object by shifting it through space with celestial magic.
spells.fullDescription: Move a tiny-sized object within 30ft using your mind up to 20ft. If you would strike a combatant with an object you are moving, make an Attunement vs AC spell attack. On hit, the target takes an amount of Force damage depending on the size and type of object used. If used to wield a weapon, apply spell attack proficiency instead of weapon proficiency, and use Attunement as the attack and damage stat.

spells.name: Moonbeam
spells.shortDescription: Fire a ray of celestial energy at a single foe.
spells.fullDescription: Target takes 2d8(+Att) Cosmic Damage.

spells.name: Enshaden
spells.shortDescription: Wrap a nearby location in dampening shadows. Muffling sounds within and creating a gyre of impenetrable darkness.
spells.fullDescription: A 10ft radius within 100ft becomes covered with shadows. Stealth checks are advantaged while in this space, passive detection automatically fails against anyone within, and any perception checks to see or hear anything within are disadvantaged. For those caught within the space, this is considered true darkness, and all visual perception checks are disadvantaged and passive detection of anything fails. Lasts for two minutes (three rounds).

spells.name: Darkvision
spells.shortDescription: Moonface has granted you the ability to see in darkness as if it were day.
spells.fullDescription: You gain 60ft of dark vision.

spells.name: Gravity Sink
spells.shortDescription: Open up a gravitational disturbance beside a group of adversaries, tugging them off-center and dealing heavy force damage to them.
spells.fullDescription: Target takes 2d6(+Att) Force Damage and you can choose to either pull them closer to you or shove them away 10ft.

spells.name: Escritorio's Blessing
spells.shortDescription: Escritorio intervenes in a dire situation, using the power granted by his place on the Shifting Throne to rewrite reality
spells.fullDescription: Make a Religion vs. 15(-DevotionLevel) skill check. On success, you succeed a failed saving throw. You then gain advantage on saving throws of this type for the next 5 minutes (3 rounds). You gain one point of devotion. Can only be used once between long rests.

spells.name: Cell Shaping
spells.shortDescription: Shape with the individual cells of a non-sentient living object. You can cause it to flourish or wither. Allows the spontaneous growth and decay of plantlife, fungi, bacterium, etc.
spells.fullDescription: Cause a living non sentient object you are touching to grow or decay. Among other things, you can cause a plant to bear fruit out of season, grow a tree to extraordinary heights, or wither away.  You must remain in contact with the object for up to 6 hours for the effect to take place completely. Time required depends on the scale of the Shaping.

spells.name: Windshaping
spells.shortDescription: You can shape the wind to your tastes.
spells.fullDescription: Shape the wind. Cause the wind to gather in a point within 5ft, or pull gusts in any direction of your choice within 50ft. Any number of targets along a contiguous line of the windâ€™s movement units make Dex vs Attunement saves or take 1d4(+Att) force damage and are knocked prone (save Con vs Att). If you already have the wind gathered at a point near you, you can send a larger gust at a target within 25ft. Make an Att vs. Dex spell attack on the target. On hit, the gust deals 1d8(+Att) force damage and knocks the target back 5ft (save Con vs Att).

spells.name: Upgraded Cell Shaping
spells.shortDescription: Shape with the individual cells of a non-sentient living object, you can cause it to flourish or wither. Allows the spontaneous growth and decay of plantlife, fungi, bacterium, etc.
spells.fullDescription: Cause a living non sentient object within 30ft to grow or decay. Among other things, you can cause a plant to bear fruit out of season, grow to extraordinary heights, or wither away. You must remain near the object for up to 8 hours for the effect to take place completely. Time required depends on the scale of the Shaping

spells.name: Gust of Wind
spells.shortDescription: Gather a squall in your hands and send it hurtling at a nearby foe.
spells.fullDescription: Targets takes 1d12(+Att) Force Damage and is knocked prone (Dex save vs Att).

spells.name: Lightshaped Orb
spells.shortDescription: Gather a small orb of light that hovers above your head.
spells.fullDescription: A floating ball of light appears above your head, giving off 60ft of daylight. Outside of combat, you and all allies within 10ft of the orb gain 1d4(+Att) Stamina every 20 mins.

spells.name: Thunderbolt
spells.shortDescription: Blast a distant target with a jolt of electricity
spells.fullDescription: Target takes 2d6 (+Att) Bolt Damage and is paralyzed (Save Con vs 15).

spells.name: Blessing of the Architect
spells.shortDescription: You feel the earth around you settle into place as you gird yourself with Gogeâ€™s strength.
spells.fullDescription: Make a Religion check vs. 15(-DevotionLevel). On success, you gain +2 Strength and +2 AC for the next hour. You gain one point of devotion.

spells.name: Sculptor
spells.shortDescription: Channel Goge to shape the earth in any shape you please.
spells.fullDescription: Shape up to 15ft (3 squares) of contiguous stone within 40ft. Shape the stone into a wall, cause it to cave into a pit, etc. Combatants within the affected area make a Dex vs. 12 spell save or take 1d4(+Att) force damage and are knocked prone. On success, target shifts out of the affected area.

spells.name: Quake
spells.shortDescription: Cause a small tremor beneath the feet of your foes to knock them to the ground.
spells.fullDescription: Make a 10ft burst with a corner in range. This area is now difficult terrain. All combatants in range make a Dex vs Att saving throw. On fail, targets take 1d6(+Att) force damage and are knocked prone. On success, targets take half force damage.

spells.name: Pillar of Earth
spells.shortDescription: Pull a thick pillar of earth out of the ground to send a combatant skyward.
spells.fullDescription: A 10ft radius within 50ft is risen 30ft into the air. Ranged attacks made from the pillar are advantaged at those below, and ranged attacks made at targets on top of the pillar are disadvantaged. Melee attacks cannot be made from nor at the top of the pillar.

spells.name: Hammer of Stone
spells.shortDescription: Reach into the earth and tear out a hammer formed from the stones of Aldmerra.
spells.fullDescription: Conjure a hammer from stone or earth you can reach. Consider this a magic mace for its properties and proficiency purposes. As a weapon attack action, you can swing the hammer at a target, making an Attunement vs. AC melee weapon attack on the target, dealing 1d10(+Att) force damage, and knocking the target prone (save Dex vs Att).

spells.name: Boulder Throw
spells.shortDescription: Break a chunk of earth away and hurl it at a nearby target.
spells.fullDescription: Target takes 1d12(+Att) Force damage and is knocked prone.

spells.name: Blessing of the Light
spells.shortDescription: The pure radiant light of Faelinaâ€™s presence appears to you in your time of need.
spells.fullDescription: Make a Religion check vs. 15(-DevotionLevel). On success, you or an ally within 30ft recover 2d10(+Att) life. You gain one point of devotion.

spells.name: Healing Touch
spells.shortDescription: Channel the radiance of Faelina through your hands to heal.
spells.fullDescription: Lay hands on a willing living entity. Heal the unit for 1d6(+Att) Life, Will, or Stamina.

spells.name: Lightshard
spells.shortDescription: Fire a shard of crystalized light at a single foe.
spells.fullDescription: Target takes 3d4(+Att) Radiant Damage.

spells.name: Embrighten
spells.shortDescription: Reveal a location in vindicating light. All units in stealth are forced into the bright.
spells.fullDescription: A 30ft radius within 100ft becomes Embrightened. Stealth checks in the area are disadvantaged. This area gives off 100ft of daylight. Furthermore, any units currently undetected in the radius must make a disadvantaged Dexterity save vs Attunement or be revealed.

spells.name: True Word: Calm
spells.shortDescription: Faelina reveals to you the words to calm an Earthborn heart. Speak them to restore order to a tempestuous heart.
spells.fullDescription: A hostile humanoid in range, or a humanoid that is Frenzied must make an Intelligence vs Attunement saving throw. On fail, the unit becomes pacified temporarily, and its frenzy is cured.

spells.name: True Word: Light
spells.shortDescription: Speak into existence a cascade of radiance. Living units in the radius are healed, while undead and demonic units are damaged.
spells.fullDescription: Spark a 10ft burst within 60ft. All living units within AoE are healed 2d6(+Att) life and 1d4(+Att) stamina. Non-living and Demonic units make a Con vs Att saving throw. On fail, these units take 2d12(+Att) Radiant damage.

spells.name: Blessing of the Dice
spells.shortDescription: Roll the Dice and see if the house pays out.
spells.fullDescription: Make a Luck check vs. 10. On success, recover 1d20 life, will, and stamina. You gain one point of devotion. Can only be used once between long rests.

spells.name: Get Creative!
spells.shortDescription: Turn a weapon you have equipped into a random alternative. With Garthankâ€™s blessing, this can turn the tides of combat.
spells.fullDescription: Roll Garthankâ€™s dice (D6,D8, D10). Your equipped weapon is transmogrified into a random alternative based on the quality of the roll

spells.name: Cat's Lives
spells.shortDescription: A cat has nine lives, why should you only have one?
spells.fullDescription: If you would take damage from a harmful effect, you can expend one of your Catâ€™s Lives to reduce this damage to 0. You have Catâ€™s Lives equal to your Devotion Level. You recover half (rounded up) of your total Catâ€™s Lives whenever you take a long rest.

spells.name: Lucky Break
spells.shortDescription: Catch a break on an attack roll by making a miss hit, or by making an opponentâ€™s hit miss.
spells.fullDescription: An attack roll that is targeting you, or you make an attack against a target that does not hit. Either reduce or increase the value of that roll by 1d10.

spells.name: Tip the Scales
spells.shortDescription: Nudge a damage die in your favor by increasing damage you or an ally deals, or decreasing the damage of an opponent.
spells.fullDescription: After an effect you or an ally within 100ft controls deals damage to an opponent, or you or an ally within 100ft would take damage from an opponentâ€™s effect. Roll the damage dice twice and take either the higher or lower value.

spells.name: Aural Apparition
spells.shortDescription: Conjure a phantasmal sound to trick your foes. Auditory illusion only.
spells.fullDescription: Roll a Performance check vs. 16(-Devotion Level). On success,  create a convincing sound of your choice at the target. Foes must save Attunement vs. Charisma or be fooled by your sound.

spells.name: Play a Trick!
spells.shortDescription: Spice up life by playing a trick or two! Permanently transform an object into a random alternative.
spells.fullDescription: Roll Garthankâ€™s dice (D6,D8, D10). The target is transmogrified into a random alternative based on the quality of the roll.
